intro: Lunathyrium unifurcatum, commonly known as the single-branch moonflower, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It is characterized by its small, pale purple flowers that open at night, emitting a subtle fragrance to attract nocturnal pollinators. The plant has a short, upright stem with few leaves, and its flowers are clustered in a unique, spiral-like arrangement. It thrives in cool, moist environments and requires specific soil conditions to flourish. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
